      • relativeDirection

        public int relativeDirection(Piece piece,
                             HexCoord from,
                             HexCoord to)
        Method for getting the relative direction value of a piece, called by the Interpreter so robots can scan properly.
        Parameters:
        piece - - The piece calculating the direction
        from - - The space the reference piece is occupying
        to - - The space the reference piece wants the relative direction too.
        Returns:

      • shootSpace

        public void shootSpace(HexCoord targetHex)
        This method is called when a player attempts to shoot at a hexagon space. Reshooting in the same turn is not allowed, and shooting outside of the piece's range is not allowed.
        Parameters:
        targetHex: - the target hexagon that is intended to be shot

      • shootSpace

        public void shootSpace(java.lang.Integer distance,
                       java.lang.Integer direction)
        Shoot method called by the Interpreter using an AI program's distance and direction values for a space.
        Parameters:
        distance - - The shortest distance to the target space.
        direction - - The relative direction to the target space.

      • getVisibleRobotsToPiece

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getVisibleRobotsToPiece(int offset)
        Helper method for checking which robots a given piece can see. Called by the Display to implement the fog of war.
        Parameters:
        offset - The piece doing the visibility checking.
        Returns:
        A list of the offsets of visible robots.

        A list of the offsets of visible robots.

      • nextPiece

        public int nextPiece(int pieceIndex)
        This method simply determines and returns the offset of next piece that is to play in the game.
        Parameters:

                                       Piece piece)
        Is the hex visible to the piece?
        Parameters:

        piece: - The piece who wants to check
        Returns:

      • isVisibleToPiece

        public boolean isVisibleToPiece(int current,
                                int offset)
        Method for checking whether one piece can see another. Used to implement the fog of war.
        Parameters:
        current - The current piece.
        offset - The piece to investigate
        Returns:
        true if the piece is visible and alive, false otherwise.

      • scanArea

        public java.util.List<HexCoord> scanArea(PieceEnum scanningPieceType,
                                         HexCoord scanLocation)
        This method takes in the enumeration that represents the piece that is performing the scan operation and the target coordinate of the hexagon space, which must be a valid coordinate, that is being scanned and then returns a list of HexCoord elements representing the coordinates that are determined to be occupied.
        Parameters:
        scanningPieceType -
        scanLocation -
        Returns:
        a list of HexCoord elements representing the coordinates that are determined to be occupied.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException - if the location is outside of the board.

      • scanCurrentArea

        public java.util.List<HexCoord> scanCurrentArea()
        Scans the area around the current piece
        Returns:
        all the coordinates of pieces that it can see from its range.

      • scanSpace

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> scanSpace(HexCoord coord)
        This method takes in one coordinate of a hexagon space, which must be valid coordinate, and returns a list of pieces determined to be occupying the space.
        Parameters:
        coord -
        Returns:
        List of Pieces' offset that occupy the space
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException

        Parameters:
        coord1 -
        coord2 -
        Returns:
